title: How to Draw a Simple Pig

steps.headline: Draw a simple round circle.
steps.description: This will be the shape of the head.

steps.headline: Add facial guidelines to keep the facial details straight.
steps.description: This includes a curved line, and two parallel lines.

steps.headline: Draw a curved oval overlapping the head, but erase the overlapping part, because you won't need it.
Draw a shaped line that forms the snout.
Draw another curved line where the snout is to complete the snout.
steps.description: Then add two ovals, and color them in with black. These are the nostrils.

steps.headline: Draw two small ovals between parallel lines, to make the eyes.
Draw the ears by drawing triangular, floppy looking ears.
Draw a "cut" in the eye, and fill it in with the color black.
steps.description: Then draw the inside of the ear by drawing a shape that looks like a teardrop. Now you are going to draw more of the body. Follow the picture for this step. Don't forget the curly tail.

steps.headline: Erase your guidelines, and ink in the pig with a sharpie.

tyn: Optional: Sharpie (if you want to ink it)
Optional: Crayons, markers, or colored pencils (if you want to color it in)
